ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The GetFeatureInfo request behaves properly.

xsl:when.ctl:message: The GetFeatureInfo request is not supported.
No queryable layers in capabilities XML.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:exceptions
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The EXCEPTIONS parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:feature_count
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The FEATURE_COUNT parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:info_format
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The FORMAT parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:i-and-j
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The I and J parameters behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:query-layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The QUERY_LAYERS parameter behaves properly.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:exceptions-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and the EXCEPTIONS parameter is absent from the request, then the response is a valid exception with a Content-type header of text/xml.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Content-type header was instead of text/xml.
The results do not validate against the exceptions schema.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:exceptions-xml
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=XML, then the response is a valid exception with a Content-type header of text/xml.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Content-type header was instead of text/xml.
The results do not validate against the exceptions schema.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:feature_count-default
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the FEATURE_COUNT parameter is not specified, then less data is returned than when FEATURE_COUNT is 2.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:feature_count-1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When the FEATURE_COUNT parameter is 1, then less data is returned than when FEATURE_COUNT is 2.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:invalid-info_format
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetFeatureInfo request is made with an invalid INFO_FORMAT parameter, then the server returns an exception (code=InvalidFormat).

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:each-info_format
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$format}, when the INFO_FORMAT parameter is set to that format, the MIME type of the response matches that format.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:invalid-i
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetFeatureInfo request is made with an invalid I parameter, then the response is an exception (code=InvalidPoint).

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:invalid-j
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetFeatureInfo request is made with an invalid J parameter, then the response is an exception (code=InvalidPoint).

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:two-query_layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetFeatureInfo request contains two layers, then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:three-query_layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetFeatureInfo request contains three layers, then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:less-query_layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a GetFeatureInfo request contains fewer layers in the QUERY_LAYERS parameter than it does in the LAYERS parameter, then the response is valid.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:invalid-query_layers
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When a layer requested is not contained in the Capabilities XML of the WMS, then the server issues a Service Exception (code=LayerNotDefined).

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:query_layers-not-queryable
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: When GetFeatureInfo is requested on a Layer that is not queryable, then the server issues a Service Exception (code=LayerNotQueryable).

xsl:when.ctl:message: No named layers that are not queryable.

ctl:test.name: getfeatureinfo:each-queryable-layer
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: For {$layer}, when the QUERY_LAYERS parameter is set to that layer name, the MIME type of the response is valid.
